intro: Lacis fucoides, commonly known as the green sea lettuce, is a type of green algae belonging to the family Ulvaceae. It is characterized by its flat, ribbon-like thallus that ranges in color from bright green to dark green. This algae typically grows in marine environments, often on rocky substrates in shallow coastal waters. Lacis fucoides plays a vital role in coastal ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various marine organisms. It is also used in some traditional medicines and as a source of bioactive compounds.
